Mobile bankers left vulnerable: 47% of UK consumers manage finances on insecure smartphones
August 2020 by Kaspersky
New research has revealed that UK consumers carry out online banking on smartphones and devices that are potentially vulnerable to a security breach, despite making sure they keep their desktop or laptop computers safe. In a study commissioned by Kaspersky, nearly half (47%) of smartphone owners who use a banking app don't protect their mobile device with antivirus or security software...
